lessons.title: What is Project Management?
lessons.description: Discover the core definition of project management and how it differs from operations.
lessons.scenario: Alex Chen's first day at Savory & Co. - learning what makes restaurant launches different from daily operations.

lessons.title: The Project Manager Role
lessons.description: Understand the responsibilities and competencies of an effective project manager.
lessons.scenario: Alex learns what it really means to be a PM when Carlos assigns the flagship restaurant opening project.

lessons.title: Project Stakeholders
lessons.description: Learn to identify and categorize the people who impact or are impacted by your project.
lessons.scenario: The new restaurant has dozens of stakeholders - from investors to neighbors. Who matters most?

lessons.title: Project Life Cycles
lessons.description: Understand how projects move through predictable phases from initiation to closure.
objectives: Understand predictive vs adaptive life cycles
lessons.scenario: Planning the restaurant opening timeline - what needs to happen before construction can even begin?

lessons.title: Organizational Structures
lessons.description: Learn how organizational structure affects project manager authority and team dynamics.
objectives: Compare functional, matrix, and projectized structures
Understand PM authority in each structure
lessons.scenario: Savory & Co. is reorganizing - how will the new structure affect Alex's project authority?

lessons.title: Project Constraints
lessons.description: Master the interplay between scope, time, cost, quality, risk, and resources.
lessons.scenario: The investor wants the restaurant open 2 weeks early. What gives - budget, scope, or quality?

lessons.title: Project Success & Value
lessons.description: Define what project success means beyond on-time and on-budget delivery.
lessons.scenario: The restaurant opened on time, but reviews are mixed. Was the project really successful?

lessons.title: Project Integration Basics
lessons.description: Learn how to coordinate all project elements into a cohesive whole.
objectives: Develop an integrated project management approach
lessons.scenario: Alex must write the charter for a new Savory & Co. location - bringing all the pieces together.

lessons.title: Stakeholder Identification & Prioritization
lessons.description: Learn systematic approaches to identify all stakeholders and prioritize engagement.
objectives: Use multiple techniques to identify stakeholders
lessons.scenario: A new investor joins Savory & Co. mid-project. How do you quickly assess their influence and expectations?

lessons.title: Stakeholder Power-Interest Analysis
lessons.description: Apply the power-interest grid to develop stakeholder management strategies.
lessons.scenario: The health inspector has low interest but high power. The food blogger has high interest but low power. Different strategies needed!

lessons.title: Stakeholder Engagement Planning
lessons.description: Create actionable engagement plans tailored to each stakeholder's needs.
objectives: Assess current vs desired engagement levels
lessons.scenario: The head chef is 'resistant' to the new menu system. How do you move them to 'supportive'?

lessons.title: Communication Methods & Channels
lessons.description: Select the right communication methods for different stakeholders and situations.
objectives: Apply push, pull, and interactive communication
lessons.scenario: Bad news about a supplier delay. Email, phone call, or in-person meeting? The choice matters.

lessons.title: Managing Difficult Stakeholders
lessons.description: Handle challenging stakeholders with tact and strategic communication.
lessons.scenario: A demanding investor is calling daily with new 'suggestions.' How do you manage without alienating them?

lessons.title: Effective Communication Planning
lessons.description: Develop a comprehensive communications management plan.
lessons.scenario: Three stakeholders claim they 'weren't informed' about changes. Time for a communications overhaul.

lessons.title: Team Formation & Tuckman's Model
lessons.description: Understand how teams develop through predictable stages.
lessons.scenario: The new catering team is arguing constantly. Alex realizes they're in the storming phase - now what?

lessons.title: Building High-Performance Teams
lessons.description: Create the conditions for teams to achieve exceptional performance.
lessons.scenario: The kitchen brigade hit a wall - technically skilled but not gelling. What's missing?

lessons.title: Conflict Resolution Strategies
lessons.description: Apply different conflict resolution approaches based on situation and relationship importance.
objectives: Identify the five conflict resolution styles
Choose appropriate styles for different situations
lessons.scenario: Two sous chefs in a heated dispute over kitchen territory. Do you force a solution or let them work it out?

lessons.title: Leadership Styles
lessons.description: Adapt your leadership style to team maturity and situation.
objectives: Match style to team development stage
lessons.scenario: Three teams with different experience levels. One leadership approach won't work for all.

lessons.title: Motivation & Recognition
lessons.description: Understand what motivates team members and how to recognize contributions.
lessons.scenario: Top chef threatens to quit despite great pay. Money isn't everything - what else do they need?

lessons.title: Project Charter Development
lessons.description: Create the foundational document that formally authorizes a project.
lessons.scenario: Before spending a dollar, Alex needs a signed charter. What goes in it?

lessons.title: Project Management Plan
lessons.description: Develop the comprehensive plan that guides project execution.
lessons.scenario: The project plan is 50 pages. The sponsor wants a summary. How do you communicate the essentials?

lessons.title: Direct & Manage Project Work
lessons.description: Lead the team to execute the project management plan.
lessons.scenario: Construction is underway. Alex must keep everyone aligned while handling daily decisions.

lessons.title: Managing Project Knowledge
lessons.description: Capture, share, and leverage project knowledge effectively.
lessons.scenario: The experienced PM is leaving. How do you capture their hard-won wisdom before they go?

lessons.title: Monitor & Control Project Work
lessons.description: Track, review, and regulate project progress and performance.
lessons.scenario: The project is 10% over budget at the halfway point. Is this recoverable or a disaster in the making?

lessons.title: Integrated Change Control
lessons.description: Manage changes systematically to protect project baselines.
objectives: Assess impact across all project areas
lessons.scenario: The investor wants to add a rooftop bar. Major scope change - how do you handle it properly?

lessons.title: Project Closure
lessons.description: Finalize all activities and formally close the project.
lessons.scenario: The restaurant is open and running. But the project isn't done until the paperwork is complete.

lessons.title: Benefits Realization
lessons.description: Ensure the project delivers its intended business value.
objectives: Transition to operations for ongoing value
lessons.scenario: Six months after opening. Is the restaurant delivering the ROI that justified the investment?

lessons.title: Cost Estimation & Budgeting
lessons.description: Estimate costs accurately and develop a realistic budget.
lessons.scenario: The CFO wants a budget. Alex has incomplete information. How accurate can the estimate be?

lessons.title: Earned Value Management
lessons.description: Track project performance using EVM metrics.
objectives: Calculate PV, EV, AC, SV, CV
Forecast completion with EAC and ETC
lessons.scenario: The sponsor asks: 'Are we on track?' EVM gives you the objective answer.

lessons.title: Critical Path Method
lessons.description: Identify the longest path through the project network.
objectives: Identify float and the critical path
lessons.scenario: Kitchen equipment delivery is delayed. Does this affect the opening date? CPM tells you.

lessons.title: Schedule Compression Techniques
lessons.description: Shorten the schedule when needed without sacrificing scope.
lessons.scenario: The opening must happen before the holiday season. How do you compress a 12-week schedule to 10?

lessons.title: Risk Identification & Analysis
lessons.description: Systematically identify and analyze project risks.
lessons.scenario: What could go wrong with the restaurant opening? Brainstorming reveals 47 potential risks.

lessons.title: Risk Response Planning
lessons.description: Develop strategies to address identified risks.
objectives: Apply avoid, mitigate, transfer, accept strategies
lessons.scenario: The top risk is supplier bankruptcy. Do you avoid, mitigate, transfer, or accept?

lessons.title: Risk Monitoring & Control
lessons.description: Track risks and implement response plans throughout the project.
lessons.scenario: A supplier just filed for bankruptcy. Good thing you had a contingency plan ready.

lessons.title: Quality Planning & Assurance
lessons.description: Define quality standards and ensure processes can meet them.
lessons.scenario: What does 'quality' mean for a restaurant? Health codes are just the minimum.

lessons.title: Quality Control & Continuous Improvement
lessons.description: Measure results and drive continuous improvement.
lessons.scenario: Customer complaints are rising. Time for root cause analysis and process improvement.

lessons.title: Procurement & Contracts
lessons.description: Manage procurement processes and contract types.
lessons.scenario: Fixed-price or cost-plus for the kitchen equipment? The choice affects risk allocation.

lessons.title: Scrum Fundamentals & Roles
lessons.description: Understand the Scrum framework and its three core roles.
objectives: Define Product Owner, Scrum Master, Development Team
Distinguish Scrum roles from traditional PM
lessons.scenario: Savory & Co. is going agile for menu development. Who plays what role in Scrum?

lessons.title: Agile Team Formation & Dynamics
lessons.description: Build self-organizing, cross-functional agile teams.
lessons.scenario: The innovation lab team needs to self-organize. How much structure is too much?

lessons.title: Sprint Planning & Execution
lessons.description: Plan and execute time-boxed sprints effectively.
lessons.scenario: Two-week sprint to develop three new menu items. How do you plan for success?

lessons.title: Daily Standup & Collaboration
lessons.description: Run effective daily standups and foster team collaboration.
lessons.scenario: Daily standups are becoming 30-minute status meetings. How do you get them back on track?

lessons.title: Sprint Review & Demos
lessons.description: Demonstrate completed work and gather stakeholder feedback.
lessons.scenario: Stakeholders taste the new dishes. Their feedback will shape the next sprint.

lessons.title: Sprint Retrospectives
lessons.description: Reflect on the sprint and commit to improvements.
objectives: Identify what went well and what to improve
lessons.scenario: The team is frustrated. The retro surfaces issues no one wanted to discuss openly.

lessons.title: Agile Principles & Values
lessons.description: Understand the Agile Manifesto and its underlying principles.
objectives: Explain the four values of the Agile Manifesto
Recognize agile mindset vs just practices
lessons.scenario: The team is 'doing Scrum' but not being agile. What's the difference?

lessons.title: Predictive vs Adaptive Approaches
lessons.description: Choose the right approach based on project characteristics.
objectives: Select approach based on uncertainty and complexity
lessons.scenario: Construction is predictive. Menu development is adaptive. How do you manage both?

lessons.title: User Story Writing & INVEST
lessons.description: Write effective user stories that drive development.
objectives: Write user stories in proper format
lessons.scenario: The Product Owner writes vague requirements. Teaching them user story format changes everything.

lessons.title: Backlog Refinement & Prioritization
lessons.description: Maintain a healthy product backlog through ongoing refinement.
lessons.scenario: 100 items in the backlog. What gets worked on first? Prioritization frameworks help.

lessons.title: Kanban Fundamentals
lessons.description: Apply Kanban principles to visualize and optimize flow.
lessons.scenario: The prep kitchen is a bottleneck. Kanban reveals where work is piling up.

lessons.title: Agile Estimation Techniques
lessons.description: Estimate work using story points and relative sizing.
lessons.scenario: How long will the new menu take? Story points give a better answer than hours.

lessons.title: Agile Metrics & Tracking
lessons.description: Use agile metrics to track progress and predict delivery.
lessons.scenario: The sponsor asks: 'When will it be done?' Burndown charts show the trend.

lessons.title: Definition of Done
lessons.description: Establish clear criteria for when work is truly complete.
lessons.scenario: The chef says the dish is 'done' but it hasn't been plated or photographed. What does done really mean?
